page.title: 05METAL BOX 2
page.content: A coil weighing 8 tons is loaded onto the{cut up line}and fed through rollers to remove the curvature. It is {automatically inspected}for thickness and damage.The metal is cut into pieces of specific size,stacked onto wooden boards in quantities weighing between 1 and 2 tons and carried to the{lacquer machine}which coats the upper surface for protection.The sheets are then{baked.}A series of passes through the printing presses builds up the pattern and applies{ {varnish}.Fine scroll shears then cut the metal into strips and the can ends are pressed out.Other sheets are cut by a{slitter.The body maker machine} folds and welds the pieces into cylinders.These progress to the {flanger}which flanges both ends.The bottom is attached by a seamer.Cans are tested by air pressure.
